msDesc.head: Collection of writings about Islam from the Collectio Toletana-Corpus Cluniacensis; prognostics; formulary

supportDesc.support: f. i is a parchment leaf; ff. 1-153 are paper leaves

foliation.p: Numbering in pencil in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos.

signatures.p: Quires numbers 1-19 added in pencil by a modern hand to the lower outer corners of the first rectos of quires.

note.p: A list of contents in two hands (one 14th-century, the other later) on f. i verso (for further details, see Part 1) .

binding.p: Modern 20th-century brown leather binding; a spine with five raised bands and the gold-stamped inscription: C.C.C.C. and MS. 335.

provenance.p: Ely Cathedral PrioryEly Cathedral: a partially erased ownership inscription on f. 152v: Iste liber pertinet ecclesie Elien[sis] (see Ker (1941), p. 42); Ker (1964), p. 78). M.R. James (1912) also thought that the cross-like mark that typically denotes books from Ely had been torn out of the fore-edge margin of f. 1r (for a surviving example of this mark, see Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 416, f. 1r). That evidence of Ely provenance is found in both Parts 2 and 3, and that the tables of contents added to Parts 1 and 3 covers the texts in both Parts 1 and 2, indicates that the whole manuscript (rather than just a part of it) was held at Ely.

Matthew Parker (1504-1575) Parker, Matthew, 1504-1575, archbishop of Canterbury: the manuscript is recorded as De rebus Turcicis / Petrus abbas cluniacensis / Petrus Alphonsus among the Libri in minore Bibliotheca on f. 60v of his register of books, now Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 575 [see M.R. James (1912), I, p. xxxvi].

acquisition.p: Presented to Corpus Christi College by Matthew Parker (1504-1575) Parker, Matthew, 1504-1575: its book stamp (Corpus Christi College, Cambidge) with the manuscript's classmark inscribed in ink (MS 335) on f. a recto. Its classmark gold-stamped on the spine; and the number 335 inscribed in pencil in the outer margin of f. 1r. Listed as no. 260 in Thomas James's Ecloga Oxonio-Catabrigiensis, printed in London in 1600; no. Q.6 in William Stanley, Catalogus librorum manuscriptorum in Bibliotheca Collegiis Corporis Christi in Cantabrigia: Quos legauit Matthaeus Parkerus Archiepiscopus Cantuariensis, printed in London in 1722 (see also the inscription Q.6 on f. i recto and f. 1r (upper margin)); and no. 335 in James Nasmith, Catalogus librorum manuscriptorum quos Collegio Corporis Christi et B. Mariae Virginis in Academia Cantabrigiensis legauit Reverendissimus in Christo Pater Matthaeus Parker, Archiepiscopus Cantuariensis printed in Cambridge in 1777.

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry draws on M.R. James, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge, 2 vols (Cambridge, 1912), no. 335. Images and a description of the manuscript are also available on the Parker Library website: the online catalogue entry for the item published at Parker on the Web Corpus Christi College, MS 335.

availability.p: Visitors to Corpus Christi College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Parker Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Parker Library: Information for Readers.

listBibl.bibl: For a bibliography for this item maintained by Corpus Christi College Cambridge see: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 335: Zotero Bibliography

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 335, f. i

msItem.title: Legal document
msItem.author: William de Belvero (public notary)
msItem.incipit: i verso dicta tenementa seu eorum retencione ad conseruacionem
msItem.explicit: i verso et Johanne de Huntyngdon testibus ad premissa vocat. specialiter et rogatis
msItem.finalRubric: i verso Et ego Willelmus de Beluero clericus Lincolniensis diocesis publicus Imperiali autoritate Notarius ; premissis omnibus et singulis per me superius expressis vna cum dictis testibus presens interfui ea nterfui ea quae sic fieri vidi et audiui et in hanc publicam et in hanc publicam formam reddegi . meo que signo consueto signaui rogatus
msItem.note: Willelmus de Beluero may be William de Belvero [of Belvoir], monk of St Albans, who became prior of Belvoir, Lincolnshire, in 1333 (on him, see 'Houses of Benedictine monks: The priory of Belvoir', in A History of the County of Lincoln: Volume 2, ed. William Page (London, 1906) at British History Online [accessed 11 November 2024]); but he may also be the Johannis de Belvero dudum canonici ecclesie Lincolniensis who died in 1391 and was buried in Lincoln Cathedral (for his brass inscription, see 'Lincoln Cathedral: A List of the Brasses Existing in 1641 ; from Mr. Peck's Collation of Bp. Sanderson's MS. Notes, Compared with Browne Willis's Copy of the Same', Monumental Brass Society, 3, Part 2: 20 (1898), 67-87 (p. 75)]. The document names Robertus de Swaffham; Alanus de Hemmyngston; Willelmus de Dynyeton (monk of Ely); Magister Geoffrey de ffreysyngfeld; Thomas de Helyesdon; Johannes de Leyham (chaplain); Willelmus Alston; Robertus de Pysale; Johannes de Melton; and John de Huntyngdon. None of the aforementioned persons have been identified but Johannes de Leyham may be John of Leyham, Vicar of Hauxton, Cambridgeshire, who is mentioned in a legal document of 1322 (see Cambridge, University Library, University Archives GBR/0012/EDC 1/B12/66).

msItem.title: Table of contents
msItem.incipit: i verso In isto quaternus continentur libri videlicet

note.p:
Full transcription of contents list:
Epistola cuiusdam saraceni ad (?)quemdam christianum
Rescriptum christiani ad saracenum
Epistola domini petri clamacis de secta Machometi
Item vita machometi
Item cronica mendosa saracenorum
Item Generacio Machometi
Item de generacione et nutritura eius
Item doctrina Machometi
Item liber contra legem sarracenorum
Item de conuersione petri alfunsi
Item tractatus de dungionibus diaboli
Item sermo de bene uiuendi
Item quedam sermones
Item tractatus de volucribus et aliis
Item de 7 signis in christi nativitate
Item tractatis de nominibus lapidum
Item Regula fratrum Minorum
Item tractatus de rebus in animatis
Item de mensibus anni
[Item] prothocol instrumentorum
[Item ...] de secretis philosophorum
Item Qualiter componuntur Instrumenta et littera cum haukeston
The rubric and entries to 'Item sermo de bene uiuendi' written by a 14th-century hand (see Script for further discussion); the rest written by a later, probably 15th-century hand.

p.seg: No ruling. Single column. Because the page has been turned vertically and then cropped to match the (rough) dimensions of this manuscript, the original height of the text space and the number of lines on the page cannot be determined.

handNote.p: The legal document has been copied by a single hand, writing in a cursive script with anglicana features.

The table of contents has been copied by a single hand, writing in a neat textualis script; perhaps the same hand that was responsible for ff. 1r-122v, 123r (verse couplet only), 123v-131v, and 136r-137v (see Part 2).

decoNote.p: Folio i verso contains a large notarial mark in brown ink.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 335, ff. 1r-137v

msItem.title: Epistula Sarraceni [Part of a dialogue known as the Apology of al-Kindi; translation of the Arabic Risalat 'Abdittah ibn-Ismail al-Hashimi ila 'Abd-al-Masih ibn-Ishaq al-Kindi wa-Risalat cd-Kindi ila al-Hashimi]
msItem.author: 'Abdullah al-Hashimi (purported)
msItem.rubric: 1r Incipit epistola saraceni ad suam sectam Christianum inuitantem
msItem.incipit: 1r In nomine dei misericordis et miseratoris adiutorium tuum o domine tempore abdalla helmenum fuit guidam de prudentissimis et excellentissimis elchesuum filii alahalet
msItem.explicit: 9v Placida et spontanea voluntate ad ea que nostra sunt venias exhortamur. vale
msItem.finalRubric: 9v Explicit epistola sarraceni inuitantis ad ad sectam suam

note.p: Purported letter of 'Abdullah al-Hashimi, a Muslim, to Abd al-Masih ibn Ishaq al-Kindi, an Arab Christian, inviting the latter to convert to Islam. Both men were in the service of caliph Al-Ma'mun (r. 813-833). Translated from Arabic into Latin by Peter of Toledo and Peter Poitiers under the title Epistola saraceni ad christinum.
On f. 1r is the sub-heading: Carta sarraceni ad Christianum.

listBibl.bibl: GonzÃ¡lez MuÃ±oz, ExposiciÃ³n (2005), pp. 1-25 [edition from another manuscript]

msItem.title: Gloss
msItem.rubric: 1r Glosa
msItem.incipit: 1r Sciendum quod ex quo sarraceni egiptum possiderunt regnum quod apud meum sis
msItem.explicit: 1r et alahabet propria nomina sent. Azoara id est capitulum siue oraculum dicitur arabice

msItem.title: Response to the Epistula Sarraceni [Part of a dialogue known as the Apology of al-Kindi; translation of the Arabic Risalat 'Abdittah ibn-Ismail al-Hashimi ila 'Abd-al-Masih ibn-Ishaq al-Kindi wa-Risalat cd-Kindi ila al-Hashimi]
msItem.author: 'Abd al-Masih ibn Ishaq al-Kindi
msItem.rubric: 9v Rescriptum Christiani ad maurum suam legem nichil esse merito rationis ostendentis
msItem.incipit: 9v In nomine dei patris et filiis et spiritus sanctis misericordis et miseratoris ad quendam filium cuiusdam quidam filius cuiusdam Christanus minimus seruorum Christi salus a deo salus et pietas et clemencia
msItem.explicit: 44r oraciones dei super eum. sit nobis deus adiutor et protector et procurator benignus in omnibus. amen
msItem.note: Purported letter of Abd al-Masih ibn Ishaq al-Kindi, an Arab Christian, to 'Abdullah al-Hashim, a Muslim, inviting the latter to convert to Christianity. Both men were in the service of caliph Al-Ma'mun (r. 813-833). Translated from Arabic into Latin by Peter of Toledo and Peter Poitiers under the title Rescriptum Christiani.

listBibl.bibl: GonzÃ¡lez MuÃ±oz, ExposiciÃ³n (2005), pp. 29-147 [edition from another manuscript]

msItem.title: Epistola de translatione sua (Letter to Bernard of Clairvaux)
msItem.author: Peter the Venerable
msItem.rubric: 44r Incipit epistola domini petri venerabilis cluniacis abbatis ad dominum Bernardum Clarevallensem abbatem de impia secta Mahumet pseudo prophete
msItem.incipit: 44v Singulari ueneracione colendo totis caritatis brachijs amplectendo indiuiduo cordis mei hospiti domino Bernardo clareuallensis abbati . frater Petrus humilis Cluniacensis abbas salutem ad quam suspirat eternam
msItem.explicit: 45r et ecclesie sue thesauros gazis uestre sapientie suppleat

msItem.title: Vita Mahumet
msItem.author: Peter the Venerable
msItem.rubric: 45r Incipit vita Mahumet
msItem.incipit: 45v Prologus. Summa tocius heresis ac diabolice secte sarracenorum
msItem.explicit: 48v hoc fieri gratum haberem

msItem.title: List of chapters to the vita Mahumet
msItem.rubric: 45v Incipit vita Mahumet
msItem.incipit: 45vIn hoc libro continentur ista. Prologus 1. In primis cuiusmodi fuerit vita siue doctrina mahumet
msItem.explicit: 45v totam impiam sectam cum auctore suo destruentis et ad nichilum redigentis

msItem.title: Preface to Fabulae Saracenorum (translation of unknown Arabic text)
msItem.rubric: 48v Prologus Roberti translatoris uiri eruditi et scolastica ad dominum Petrum abbatem
msItem.incipit: 48v Cum iubendi religio parendique votum pariter utrimque concurrunt
msItem.explicit: 49r plus nocere quam cedere affirmat

msItem.title: Fabulae Saracenorum (translation of unknown Arabic text)
msItem.rubric: 49r Cronica mendosa et ridiculosa Sarracenorum
msItem.incipit: 49r In creacionis sue primordio deus manu propria .4. condidit prout multorum arabum
msItem.explicit: 56v peremit die die 10 almuharan

msItem.title: Liber generationis Mahomet (Latin translation of the Kitab Nasab Rasul Allah by Sa'id ibn Umar]
msItem.rubric: 57r De generacione mahumet et nutritura eius. quod transtulit hermanus sclauus scolasticus subtilis et ingeniosus apud legionem hispanie ciuitatem
msItem.incipit: 57r Liber generacionis mahumet nuncii dei oracio dei super eum et salus ab adam et eva per ordinem parentum
msItem.explicit: 65r Ego regijs muneribus diues leta domum cum gratiarum actione redivi
msItem.note: On f. 61r is the sub-heading: De nativitate Mahumet prophete domini.

msItem.title: Liber de doctrina Mahumet (Latin translation of the MasÄÊ¾il Ê¿AbdallÄh ibn SalÄm)
msItem.rubric: 65r De doctrina mahumet que apud sarracenos magne auctoritatis est sub eodem hermanno translata cum esset peritissimus utriusque lingue scilicet latine et arabice
msItem.incipit: 65r Erat nuncius dei oracio dei super eum et salus sedens inter socios in ciuitate sua Jesrab et descendit super eum angelus gabriel
msItem.explicit: 73r recipe confitentem me ego credo et iudeo quod non sunt dij sed vis omnipotense cuius vere tu nuncius et propheta
msItem.note: This work is part of the so-called Corpus Cluniacense, a collection of Latin translations of Arabic works for Christian scholars, commisioned by Peter the Venerable, abbot of Cluny.

msItem.title: Preface to Latin translation of the Koran (Liber legis Saracenorum quem Alchoran uocant)
msItem.author: Robert of Ketton
msItem.rubric: 73r Prefacio Roberti translatoris ad dominum petrum cluniacensis abbati in libro legis sarracenorum quem mahumet pseudo propheta per angelum gabrielem quasi de celo sibi missa confinxit
msItem.incipit: 73r Domino suo petro
msItem.explicit: 74r nec probabilibus non nunquam necessariis argumentis insistens

msItem.title: Contra legem Sarracenorum (anti-Islamic treatise)
msItem.author: Riccoldo da Monte di Croce
msItem.rubric: 74r Incipit libellus fratris ricculdi ordinis predicatorum contra legem sarrenorum [sic: Sarracenorum] prohemium
msItem.incipit: 74r Quot sunt dies serui tui
msItem.explicit: 101r lex adeo sanctissima pariter et obseruabilis mundo

msItem.title: Speculum historiale (extracts)
msItem.author: Vincent of Beauvais
msItem.rubric: 101r De conuersione Petri alfunsi quondam iudei et edicione libri sui auctor est
msItem.incipit: 101r Eo tempore petrus alfunsus quondam iudeus et moyses appelatum iudaismum reliquit
msItem.explicit: 118v Omnipotentis dei deprecor pietatem vt me ab errore illius eruat quam cepi legem implere perficiat. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: 118v Hec vincencius in speculo lio 26 in fine eiusdem libri

msItem.title: Treatise on the tricks of the devil
msItem.rubric: 119r Incipit tractatus de dungionibusid est domibus diaboli
msItem.incipit: 119r Milicia est vita hominis super terram
msItem.explicit: 121v ad rectam voluntatem penitendi valeat reuocari

msItem.title: Sermo de modo vivendi
msItem.rubric: 121v Sermo de modo viuendi fratris bonauenture
msItem.incipit: 121v Quisquis es qui per fidem spem et caritatem
msItem.explicit: 122v uideatur deus per gloriam ad quam nos peducat. Amen

msItem.title: Excerpts on natural philosophy
msItem.incipit: 123r Cum desiderabili prosperitis
msItem.explicit: 123r exigat et exhibita beneficia persuadent

msItem.title: Tract on conception
msItem.incipit: 123r Tradunt .ii. phisici quod semen virile susceptum a muliere
msItem.explicit: 123r crementum .xv. absque errore reparies

msItem.title: Verse couplet (mnemonic) on fetal development
msItem.incipit: 123r Sex in lacte dies ter sunt in sanguine trini / Bis seni carmen ter seni membra figurant

msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.incipit: 123v Reuerendi domini legius dominus noster rex considerans discenciones et discordias quas habemus ab intrinseco
msItem.explicit: 125r et celeriter ?exequendum
msItem.note: The text quotes from the Policraticus of John of Salisbury and of Aristotle.

msItem.title: Sermon at a visitation
msItem.incipit: 125r Ponam visitacionem tuam pacem. psalmus 60. Amantissime fratres mei ratione visitacio ordinatur
msItem.explicit: 127v et nos apparebimus cum ipso in gloria

msItem.title: Historia orientalis (fragment)
msItem.author: ?Jacques de Vitry
msItem.incipit: 129r -naciones morsibus impugnant. Sunt autem magnitudine cignorum colore uineo duris et ingentibus rostris.
msItem.explicit: 129r cantum suum ad modum cithare aptat

msItem.title: Orthographia gallica (Short Version)
msItem.incipit: 132r Diccio gallice dictata habens [crossed out: scripta] dictata debet regulariter secundum quod scripta pronunciari
msItem.explicit: 132v Regulariter omnis diccio debet scribi secundum quod pronunciatur

msItem.title: On the Seven Wonders at Christ's Birth (De septem signis in Christi nativitate)
msItem.rubric: 132v De .7. signis in Christi natiuitate
msItem.incipit: 132v Primum signum natiuitatis Christi fuit quod princeps unus id est cesar augustus per omnem orbem regnabat
msItem.explicit: 133v deus fideles suos in sancta ecclesia honorare dignetur Amen

msItem.title: De duodecim lapidibus (Incertus, Chapter 58)
msItem.author: Hugo de Folieto
msItem.rubric: 133v Nomina lapidum
msItem.incipit: 133v Iaspis primus ponitur in fundamento ciuitatis dei qui talem naturam habet
msItem.explicit: 135v sed quasi vinum rubens apparens
msItem.note: The outer margin of f. 133r features the following title: Proprietates istorum xij lapidum scribuntur in lapidario.

msItem.title: Regula Bullata (Rule of St Francis)
msItem.author: Francis of Assisi
msItem.rubric: 136r Regula et vita fratrum minorum hec est silicet domini nostri ihesu Christi sanctum euaungelium obseruare vinendo in obediencia sine proprio voluntate et castitate
msItem.incipit: 136r Frater franciscus promittit obedienciam et reuerenciam domino pape
msItem.explicit: 137v et sanctum euangelium domini nostri ihesu Christi quod firmiter promisimus observemus

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in quarto. Folios 1-137v: various watermarks, including three mountains tops and bow and arrow.

p.note: This catalogue record follows the collation of M.R. James (1919) but suggests that Quires 14 and 16 originally may have been one quire - since their leaf signatures may be part of the same sequence - and that Quire 15 was bound inside this quire between its innermost leaves.

signatures.p: Leaf signatures consisting of combinations of letters and Arabic numerals in Quires 1-12 (a-m); numbers 1->3, written vertically in Quire 13; the number 3 / 4 on the third leaf of Quire 14; a combination of the letter a with Roman numerals in Quire 15; and the number 4 / 4 on the first leaf of Quire 16.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords in the lower inner margins of the last versos of quires.

p.seg: Mixed ruling: frames in ink, with occasional line ruling in leadpoint. Single columns. 34-40 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Folios 1r-122v, 123r (verse couplet only), 123v-131v, and 136r-137v have been copied by (?) one scribe, writing a neat textualis script; perhaps the same hand that was responsible for the first part of the table of contents on f. i verso (see Part 1).
The main texts on folio 123r have been copied by (?) two scribes, writing in a cursive script with anglicana features.
The main texts on folio 132r-135v have been copied by one scribe, writing in a cursive script with anglicana features.

decoNote.p: One large (6 lines) puzzle initial in blue and red with floral motifs outlinsed in red ink inside the letter on f. 1r.
Large (2-6 lines) plain initials in blue and red ink.
Headings, sub-headings, and final rubrics written in red ink.
Paraphs in blue or red ink.
Small (1 line) regular initials highlighted in red ink.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 335, ff. 138-142

msItem.title: Prognostications for each month of the year
msItem.incipit: 138r Les meys de januer appellunt les astronomianz entendement. Cil apreygnent coment lem dyst le cors grarder
msItem.explicit: 139r Sil terremoue signefie mort de prince ou de roy ou de counte ou de altrer grand gentz

msItem.title: Health regimen for the months of the year
msItem.incipit: 139r Mense januarii vinum album ieiunus bibe
msItem.explicit: 139v Nox habet horas 18 . dies vero 6

msItem.title: Legal treatise
msItem.rubric: 139v Sequitur rubrica de accionibus
msItem.incipit: 139v Nota
msItem.explicit: 142v nomine populi mihi condempnari

msItem.title: Three medical recipes for teeth and eyes
msItem.note: Above the recipes is written Gilbertus de Haneworth iuxta disce mark[et], perhaps referring to the market town Diss in Norfolk.

msItem.title: (?) legal text
msItem.rubric: 142v Si quaeratur nusquam affectus [? punitur] sed non sequitur effectus

msItem.title: Recipe for making tartar wine
msItem.incipit: 142v Recipe tartarum calcinatum cum medietatis calcis vine et ponatur in aqua calida
msItem.explicit: 142v sit aqua tartaris

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in quarto. No watermarks identified.

p.seg: No ruling. Single columns. c. 44 lines to the page.

handNote.p: Copied by several hands in a cursive anglicana script.

decoNote.p: This part of the manuscript does not contain any significant forms of decoration.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS 335, ff. 143-153

msItem.title: Copies of historical documents
msItem.note: Copies of documents, referring to Roger Raude de Kenynghale, 1386; Robert Longham, vicar of St John's, Maddermarket, at Trinity Hall, 1387; and Steucheworth (Stetchworth), 1387.

msItem.title: Formulary
msItem.note: The example letters contain reference to the Ely and the Diocese of Norwich.

msItem.title: Copy of an indenture
msItem.rubric: 153r Lopham
msItem.incipit: 153r In dei nomine amen. per praesens publicum etcaetera
msItem.explicit: 153r in le bordenhostel cantabr.
msItem.note: The indenture refers to John Lopham who is identified as a priest of Norwich.

note.p:
Full transcription of contents list:
Epistola saraseni ad sectam suam christianum inuitantem
Epistola domini petri alumacis abbatis ad Bernardum abbatum claravallensis de ipsa secta et vita pseudo prophete Macometi et opinionines et ritibus sarasenorum in alchorano eorum
Item de dungionibus id est domibus diaboli
Item Sermo Bonauenture de modo bene viuendi
Item Sermo in parliamento regis pro defensione scottorum et aliis
Item proprietatibus diuersorum piscium . volucrum . et lapidum et cetera
Item Regula et vita fratrum Minorum et eorum obseruanciis et cetera
Item tractatus de rebus inanimatis et subtilitatibus secretorum et cetera
Item Qualiter componuntur Instrumenta et littera cum Haukeston

supportDesc.support:
Paper, folded in quarto. Folios 143r-152v: bow and arrow.
Folios 153r-153v: unidentified.

signatures.p: Leaf signatures consisting of Roman numbers i-iiij in Quire 19.

p.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame only, with occasional line ruling. Single columns. c 38-48 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Copied one or more hands, writing in a cursive script with anglicana features.

decoNote.p: This part of the manuscript does not contain any significant forms of decoration.

origin.p: References to Ely and the Diocese of Norwich in the formulary, and to places in Suffolk and Norfolk in copies of documents.

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer in Curious Cures in Cambridge Libraries, Cambridge University Library
